Apr 1, 2024

I. CITY MANAGER'S AGENDA
1. Transmitting Communication from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the appropriation of
$9,987.00 received from the State Department of Early Education and Care to the Grant Fund Human
Services Salary and Wages account ($4,685) and the Grant Fund Human Services Other Ordinary
Maintenance account ($5,302). Funds will be used to support the work of the Center for Families and
the Community Learning Center in providing services to families at the State Overflow Shelter
located in Cambridge.
CMA 2024 #65
RESULT:
APPROPRIATION PLACED ON FILE CMA ADOPTED [9-0-0]

YEAS:
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Pickett,
Councillor Siddiqui, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler, Councillor Toner, Councillor
Wilson, Mayor Simmons

2. A communication transmitted from Yi-An Huang, City Manager, relative to the MBTA Track
Improvement Program work in February and July 2024 on the Red Line.
CMA 2024 #66
RESULT:
PLACED ON FILE

PAGE 2

Apr 1, 2024

II. CALENDAR

UNFINISHED BUSINESS
1. Ordinance An Ordinance 2023 #8B has been received from City Clerk, relative to Amend
Chapter 14.04 – Fair Housing.
PASSED TO A SECOND READING IN COUNCIL OCTOBER 2, 2023.
FURTHER AMENDED IN COUNCIL NOVEMBER 6, 2023.
THIS ITEM WILL REMAIN ON UNFINISHED BUSINESS UNTIL THE STATE
LEGISLATURE APPROVES THE SPECIAL ACT THAT IS NEEDED BEFORE THIS
CAN BE ORDAINED
ORDD-2023-8B
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

Next: 4/8/2024 5:30 PM

2. An Ordinance has been received relative to amending Section 3.34.070 Authorized Revolving
Funds.
PASSED TO A SECOND REAING IN COUNCIL MARCH 25, 2024.
ELIGIBLE TO BE ORDAINED APRIL 8, 2024.
ORD 2024 # 1
RESULT:
NO ACTION TAKEN

PAGE 3

Next: 4/8/2024 5:30 PM

Apr 1, 2024

III. APPLICATIONS AND PETITIONS
1. A petition was received from Uptown Transport Inc. 1430 Massachusetts Avenue, regarding a Tickets
kiosk, 4feet by 4 feet from April 12, 2024 with an end date of October 31, 2024 9:00am - 5:00PM.
APP 2024 #13
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

Apr 1, 2024

V. RESOLUTIONS
1. Congratulations to the Cambridge Rindge & Latin's Culinary Team on winning the16th Annual
Massachusetts Restaurant Association Education Foundation Statewide Culinary Arts Competition.
Councillor Toner and entire membership.
RES 2024 #52
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

2. Gratitude to the Cambridge Public Health Department for their work.
Mayor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2024 #53
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

3. Congratulations to Reverend Brenda Ann Brown on her 10th Anniversary of pastoral leadership at the
Massachusetts Avenue Baptist Church.
Mayor Simmons and entire membership.
RES 2024 #54
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

4. Congratulations to Sargeant Michael J. LeVecque on his Promotion to the Rank of Lieutenant with
the Cambridge Police Department
Councillor Toner, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Wilson and entire membership.
RES 2024 #55
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

5. Congratulations to Sergeant Paul J. Gallagher on his Promotion to the Rank of Lieutenant with the
Cambridge Police Department
Councillor Toner, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Wilson and entire membership.
RES 2024 #56
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

6. Congratulations to Sergeant Michael J. Logan on his Promotion to the Rank of Lieutenant with the
Cambridge Police Department
Councillor Toner, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Wilson and entire membership.
RES 2024 #57
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 16

Apr 1, 2024

VI. POLICY ORDER AND RESOLUTION LIST
1. City Council support of H.3012/S.2027, An Act Authorizing Project Labor Agreements, to strengthen
and secure Massachusetts’ long term economic development.
POR 2024 #47
Councillor Azeem, Vice Mayor McGovern, Mayor Simmons, Councillor Sobrinho-Wheeler,
Councillor Wilson, Councillor Pickett, Councillor Nolan, Councillor Toner, Councillor Siddiqui
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED AS AMENDED

2. Urge all Cantabrigians to pause on Patriots’ Day to pay tribute to those who died for our nation and
remember their service and devotion to this country.
POR 2024 #48
Vice Mayor McGovern, Councillor Wilson
RESULT:
ORDER ADOPTED

PAGE 17

Apr 1, 2024
